intro: Rondeletia corymbosa, commonly known as the clustered rondeletia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its showy, clustered inflorescences of small, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows as an evergreen shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters. Rondeletia corymbosa is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
